Comments_List: I have learned how to design an asynchronous circuit using syntax-directed translation: from CHP descriptions to transistor level circuits.

I learned a lot about the basics of asynchronous VLSI (silicon compilation), and how to use several tools (magic, irsim, xyce, Prsim ...) We have many quizzes and lab assignments to do, helping us figure out the whole process to design an AVLSI chip.
I think the lab assignments were of high quality. However, the schedule was too tight for each assignment, which could be improved next time.
This is a very important and interesting course, and I will definitely recommend this course to students who are interested in chip design.
Yes, I will recommend this course to another student, this course will give each student an excellent chance to learn silicon compilation.
